ETYMOLOGY: From the verb 'onlook' (to look on, observe) + the suffix '-er' (denoting a person who does an action or is associated with something).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who watches an event or incident without taking part.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 旁观者；目击者；在现场观看事件发生但未参与的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The crowd of onlookers grew larger as the emergency services arrived.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 随着紧急服务人员的到来，围观的群众越来越多。
